title: University of California and NASA Ames unveil plans for $2 billion Berkeley Space Center
summary: The University of California, Berkeley, and the NASA Ames Research Center unveiled plans Oct. 16 for a $2 billion Berkeley Space Center at NASA Research Park.

title: Space investors followed government contracts in the third quarter, report says
summary: Investment in the space sector, especially from venture capital, is consistently flowing into companies that are pursuing and winning government contracts, according to a report Monday by New York-based Space Capital.

title: After six decades, ‘Gagarin’s Start’ will meet its end as a launch pad
summary: Agreement for funding from UAE fell through after Russia invaded Ukraine.

title: Urban Sky raises $9.75 million for stratospheric imaging platform
summary: Urban Sky, a startup offering high-resolution imaging from small stratospheric balloons, has raised $9.75 million in a Series A round.

title: Two Vega VV23 Payloads Failed to Deploy
summary:
A pair of payloads that were among 12 carried to orbit aboard the Arianespace-managed Vega VV23 flight failed to be deployed and likely burned up in the atmosphere still attached to the rocket’s upper stage. The Vega VV23 flight was launched on October 9 at 01:36 UTC from the Guiana Space Centre in French Guiana. […]
The post Two Vega VV23 Payloads Failed to Deploy appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Army exploring new options to tap commercial satellite networks
summary: The Army wants seamless access to satellites in various orbits, so if one network goes down, others instantly take over.

title: Ireland Commit €3.3M More to ESA for 2024
summary:
In its recently announced budget for 2024, Ireland has increased its contribution to ESA for the year by €3.3 million. “Ireland’s commitment to the European Space Agency and Ireland’s space-active industry is steadfast,” Minister of State for Business, Employment, and Retail Neale Richmond said. “Additional funding of €3.3m is an investment that delivers a clear […]
The post Ireland Commit €3.3M More to ESA for 2024 appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Space insurers take cautious approach to satellite servicing
summary: Despite satellite malfunctions that are expected to lead to major insurance claims, the space insurance field is taking a cautious approach to servicing technologies that might be able to repair such spacecraft.

title: Frank Rubio Readjusting to Life on Earth with Ease
summary: NASA astronaut Frank Rubio is finding his readjustment to Earth’s gravity after 371 days in space pretty straightforward. Two weeks after landing, he considers himself 100 percent back to normal […]

title: SpaceX gearing op for a possible WDR as it waits for regulatory approval
summary: While Ship 26 started its engine testing campaign, SpaceX looks to be gearing up for a Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) for Booster 9 and Ship 25. Related notices have been posted for the coming week, marking the imminent return to a full stack for the next Starship to launch as soon as November, pending regulatory approval.
